intro: Rutidosis acoma, commonly known as the Acoma milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils in desert regions. It has small, hairy stems and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Rutidosis acoma is adapted to survive in harsh conditions with limited water availability.
